speaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series
text: Marsha Mason  * * *  ## Transcript {Iain McCallum}    _Act 1  Scene 1 -- Cafe Nervosa. Niles wanders into the Cafe, saying hello to Frasier and Maureen (from [[3.20]](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_20/police_story.html "Police Story"), "Police Story") who are sitting down at a nearby table._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Maureen.

speaker: Maureen
text: Hi, Niles. _Niles goes up to order at the counter where Roz is already waiting for her order._

speaker: Niles
text: A non-fat cafe, please.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll pay for his too.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thank you.  My day started off with good news and it's already getting better.  To what do I owe this largesse?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm having a pretty great day too.  You see, a few months ago I took my first tennis lesson...

speaker: Niles
text: And you've finally mastered the backhand?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I haven't played since.  But the guy who was teaching me...

speaker: Niles
text: Has won your girlish heart?

speaker: Roz
text: No, he was a loser.  But that day he hit me this little dink- shot and I ran for it, stubbed my toe, got this big black toenail.  It lasted for like three months and today it finally fell off. [_Niles looks thoroughly mystified_] I can wear sandals again!

speaker: Maureen
text: Thanks, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodbye Maureen, and good luck.

speaker: Maureen
text: Thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  May I borrow your spoon?

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly.

speaker: Niles
text: [_banging the spoon off his coffee cup_] I have an announcement.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well frankly, so do I.  Dad's girlfriend just told me some very big news.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, unless she's expecting our baby brother, my news takes precedence. [_A look of panic spreads on Niles's face_] She's not, is she?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.

speaker: Niles
text: Guess who just won this year's "Mariett Fassbinder Award for Distinguished Contribution to the Literature of Psychiatry"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, judging by the canary feathers protruding from your mouth, I'd say you.  What article did you win for?

speaker: Niles
text: A gripping case history of a narcissistic opera singer. I called it "Me Me Me Me Me."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] Very clever, I like that.

speaker: Niles
text: Thrilled as I am, I must admit I'm a tad nervous about the awards banquet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!  I want him there of course, but I'm just dreading a rerun of Aunt Vi's wedding.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes - the hour he spent regaling the table with Little Niles stories.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly.  Imagine an entire roomful of trained psychiatrists hearing the story of Sheldon, my imaginary protege.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah yes, Sheldon.  That troubled little fellow who kept wetting your bed!  Well, you know -- if you're thinking of excluding Dad from the event your timing couldn't be worse.  It's his birthday this weekend.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, right.

speaker: Frasier
text: On top of that Maureen just told me that she's decided to break it off with him.

speaker: Niles
text: No!  Oh dear, is it the age difference?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  She was quite emphatic on that point.  She just thinks they have nothing in common.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, poor Dad.  I know how much he enjoyed going out with her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Just the other day he was saying that between her police badge and his handicapped sticker they could park anywhere. _FADE OUT  Scene 2 -- Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is busy cleaning.  Daphne comes in. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne.  Thank God you're home first.  Listen, I have to warn you.

speaker: Daphne
text: About what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad and Maureen are on a date.  It's not going well.  She's telling him that she wants to break it off.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.  This vision you're getting -- is it a tingly feeling and a picture in your head, or more like a husky voice murmuring in your ear?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] It's not a vision.  Maureen told me about this, this afternoon.  I'm just worried about Dad.  We need to do everything we can to help him through this.

speaker: Daphne
text: I wouldn't worry about your father.  People are more resilient than you think.  You know, when Joe dumped me a few weeks ago I thought I'd lost the love of me life.  I figured I'd spend the rest of my years dwelling on what might have been.  The home we'd have made; the children running through it; growing old together... did I mention Joe's getting married?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I'm all right. _Daphne heads towards the drinks cabinet as she breaks down and grabs a bottle of wine._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_goes to console her_] Oh, Daphne, Daphne... [_checks the bottle's label_] That'll be fine. [_she exits_] _Meanwhile the scene switches to outside the apartment as Martin and Maureen arrive back from their date._

speaker: Maureen
text: Oh, I should have known that you'd hate Indian food.

speaker: Martin
text: No, it was great.  It just takes a little getting used to.

speaker: Maureen
text: Yeah, it does.  You should try it again sometime.

speaker: Martin
text: [_retching slightly_] I think I just did.  So are you going to come in for some coffee?

speaker: Maureen
text: Nah.  You're not feeling too well.  I think I'll just call it a night.

speaker: Martin
text: But I thought you said in the car there was something you wanted to talk about.

speaker: Maureen
text: It can wait. _They kiss goodnight as Maureen heads back into the elevator. Martin goes into the apartment._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: How was your date?

speaker: Martin
text: [_with a pained expression on his face_] Awful!  I never felt this bad in my life.  I feel like my guts have been ripped out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, let me assure you this has nothing to do with your age.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, the hell it doesn't.  This never would have happened twenty years ago.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know Dad, I may be talking out of turn here. But Maureen told me about this.

speaker: Martin
text: [_from behind the door_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  She came to me for advice.  That's how determined she was not to hurt you.  You see, she wanted to make it perfectly clear that her breaking up with you had nothing to do with your age but rather your compatibility.  You see, it's not your fault that you don't like the same food, music or movies...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...and she didn't bring this up, did she?

speaker: Martin
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: She doesn't want to see me again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I feel so terrible.  Listen, Dad, I mean, I know exactly how you're feeling right now.  But believe me, the pain will pass.  It may take some time.

speaker: Martin
text: This is great!

speaker: Frasier
text: Or not!

speaker: Martin
text: Wait till I tell Sherry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sherry?

speaker: Martin
text: [_holding up the carton of Maalox_] This stuff works pretty good.  Have we got any pretzels?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad - just who is Sherry?

speaker: Martin
text: She's this great lady I met down at McGinty's. You know -- I've been trying for weeks to get up the nerve to end it with Maureen. _He gleefully picks up the phone.  The doorbell rings and Frasier goes to answer._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord.  I've been worried all afternoon about Maureen breaking your heart and all along you've been two-timing-

speaker: Frasier
text: MAUREEN! _Frasier opens the door to Maureen while Martin slams the phone down and tries not to look too guilty._

speaker: Martin
text: Well hi, Maureen.  Come in.  Did you forget something?

speaker: Maureen
text: Yes I did. Um... [_looks at Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't mind me, I was just going out... [_he realises he is in his dressing gown_] ...to the powder room.

speaker: Maureen
text: There's something that I've been meaning to say to you and I keep putting it off and that's not fair to you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_acting concerned_] What is it?

speaker: Maureen
text: I don't think it's working out.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting down in fake shock_] You don't?  Wow.  I didn't see that coming.

speaker: Maureen
text: Marty, it's not the age difference.  It's just all we ever talk about is the police force - and I enjoy that - but I just think...

speaker: Martin
text: No, Maureen, come on.  You don't need to explain.  You know, I guess I always knew that I could never hold onto a prize like you forever. [_slams the bathroom door shut in Frasier's face with his cane_] But at least I did it for a while.

speaker: Maureen
text: So, are you OK?

speaker: Martin
text: [_acting hurt_] I will be.  It just takes a little time, you know?  But you take care of yourself.

speaker: Maureen
text: Yeah, you too. _They kiss goodbye and Maureen leaves.  Before the door is barely shut Martin is celebrating with his cane in the air and a huge grin. Frasier opens the bathroom door holding onto his eye and looking highly annoyed._

speaker: Frasier
text: You old fraud!

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You made her believe that she'd broken your heart.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, of course I did.  When a woman breaks up with you, you have to act sad.  It's only polite.

speaker: Frasier
text: Polite?  My God, Dad, guilt is a very destructive emotion.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, spare me the Ivy League bull.  There ain't a dame alive who wouldn't rather break a guy's heart than think she hadn't even made a dent in it.  I may not have made it to Harvard but I have been to the College of Love.

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently on a Spillane Fellowship! **FASTEN YOUR SEATBELTS** _Scene 3 -- Frasier's Apartment Niles arrives at Frasier's apartment carrying Martin's birthday present.  Frasier and Daphne are in the living room whilst Martin is in his bedroom. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  Where's the birthday boy?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's getting all dolled up for his lady friend. You should see how excited he is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not half as excited as he's going to be when he sees these new videotapes: twelve cassettes of the history of World War II!

speaker: Niles
text: For those who thought the original was fun but too short!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this year I thought what the hell?  Get him something he really wants rather than what I think he needs.

speaker: Niles
text: A very commendable sentiment.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you get him?

speaker: Niles
text: An Armani tux. [_pause_] Well, my banquet's coming up.

speaker: Martin
text: [_coming through in a suit_] Hey, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh.  Don't you look dapper?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, thanks.  Yeah, I heard the door -- I thought maybe it was Sherry.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I thought we were joining her and your chums down at the restaurant.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I changed my mind.  You know, I just thought that... I'm just so anxious for you to meet her, I know you're gonna love her.  No, no, forget I said that.  I mean, you will but I just don't want to jinx it. [_the doorbell rings_] Oh, there it is.  Frasier, answer the door, would you?  No, no, wait a minute.  I'll get it. _Frasier and Niles look on smiling - that is, until the door opens to reveal a middle-aged woman wearing a short pink skirt, a pink blouse and carrying a bottle and a present._

speaker: Sherry
text: Happy Birthday! _Sherry practically leaps into Martin's arms and gives him an extremely loud kiss.  The boys just look slightly aghast._

speaker: Martin
text: Come in and meet the family.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_hugging Frasier_] Hi!  Sherry Dempsey.  Now Marty didn't tell me the two of you were so handsome! [_she bearhugs Niles who forces a smile_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  Daphne Moon.

speaker: Sherry
text: Ooh -- the physical therapist.  Don't worry about me, honey. I'm not the jealous type.  Anybody that keeps my Marty limber is aces in my book.

speaker: Martin
text: [_does a few dance shuffles, then:_] Hey, sit down, Sherry. Come on.  You know Fras, Sherry is a big fan of your show.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh yes, a big fan.  Well, as a matter of fact when my friend Donna's marriage was on the rocks, you were the one that she called for advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  And did my advice prove helpful?

speaker: Sherry
text: That's not important.  You cared.  That's what matters.

speaker: Daphne
text: Can we offer you a drink?

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, actually, since it's a special occasion I brought some bubbly.  Let's crack it open! [_throws the bottle at Niles who just manages to catch it_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, why not? [_forcing a smile_] Oh look Frasier -- Cold Duck.

speaker: Sherry
text: You ever had it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just once!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll do the honours.

speaker: Sherry
text: Ooh, I love this apartment.  Wow, that's some view you've got.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Sherry
text: Which room's mine?

speaker: Sherry
text: Gotcha!

speaker: Martin
text: She's always doing stuff like that.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, I love making people laugh.  To me humour is like medicine.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sotto voce to Frasier_] Guess we're in the placebo group.

speaker: Frasier
text: So... Dad tells me you two kids met at McGinty's.

speaker: Sherry
text: That's right.  I tend bar there.  Saw your Dad there one night looking kind of lonesome and I said to myself...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coming through with the drinks_] Bottoms up!

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, something like that.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_dishing the drinks out_] Here we go.  Well, Happy Birthday.

speaker: Sherry
text: Through the lips and over the gums...

speaker: Frasier
text: Look out, tastebuds, here it comes.

speaker: Sherry
text: I never heard that version. _They all take a sip.  However, Frasier and Niles turn around looking as though they're about to vomit.  Both go to recover on the couch while trying to force their now customary smile._

speaker: Sherry
text: I better be careful.  Two glasses of that and I'd be dancing on the tables.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  You know, Sherry used to be on the stage.

speaker: Frasier
text: On Broadway?

speaker: Sherry
text: Las Vegas.  Ever been there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just once!

speaker: Sherry
text: What a town, huh?  Great food, terrific theatre, just too darn easy to get married. [_looks at Niles_] You're separated, right?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Sherry
text: I've been there.  Listen, you want my advice?

speaker: Niles
text: Well...

speaker: Sherry
text: Don't mope!  Get right back in the saddle.  My Mum always used to say to me, "Honey, the only way to get over someone is to get under someone." _Martin laughs hysterically at this joke.  Needless to say Niles just looks a bit shocked._

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, Momma had lots of sayings like that.

speaker: Niles
text: [_slipping further down the sofa_] I didn't know Mae West had children.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hey, we better be going, so if you want to freshen up you better do it now.  It's right down there.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll show you the way.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_to Martin_] I know what you're doing here.  You just want the reviews. [_looking at Frasier and Niles_] Talk me up.

speaker: Martin
text: That's not it at all.  You think you're so smart. [_turning to Frasier and Niles_] Well, what do you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lost for words_] Er... Wow.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Er... I see that Wow and raise you a Zowie.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm so glad you like her.  You really do, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Martin
text: That's it, great!  Well, you know we're going to have to spend more time here.  You know, she's got that fourth floor walk-up and its murder on my hip.  Not that I wouldn't climb the Space Needle to hear her play that banjo of hers. _Frasier and Niles can't say anything.  Instead they simply reach for their Cold Duck and swig it down.  Sherry and Daphne come back through._

speaker: Sherry
text: Come on, boys.  She's back.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I keep meaning to ask: what's that lovely perfume you're wearing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I've been wondering that myself.

speaker: Sherry
text: It's called Milady's Boudoir. [_heading out the door followed by Martin and Daphne_] You wouldn't believe what a bargain it is.  For a hundred bucks I could buy enough to drown myself in.

speaker: Niles
text: [_slowly walking out the door with Frasier_] I've got sixty! **NO GIRLZ ALLOWED** _Scene 3 -- Cafe Nervosa Niles and Frasier are sitting down at a table drinking their coffees. _

speaker: Niles
text: Again, I'm sorry for not making it over for dinner last night, but you know I had this tickle in my throat...

speaker: Frasier
text: Spare me your lame excuses, Niles.  We both know why you weren't there.

speaker: Niles
text: How was Sherry?

speaker: Frasier
text: Colourful as ever.  Last night she treated us to a selection from her unpublished volume of Limericks for Lovers.  The last several were about a well-travelled man fortuitously named Horatio! _Niles takes a second before he realises and just looks disgusted. Suddenly panic spreads on his face._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God.  Don't turn around.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who is it?

speaker: Niles
text: It's Dad, and he's brought Sophie Tucker!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God.  But this is our place.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't look. _Martin and Sherry walk in and needless to say Sherry sees the boys immediately and knocks loudly on the window to them._

speaker: Sherry
text: Hey!  How ya doing?  Look who's here.  Wow, what a cute place this is.  I walk by here all the time and never stopped in.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well the boys love it here.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, we should start coming here.  Now, make room at that table.  We'll be right back.  We're gonna get a cuppa.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_forlorn_] Quick Niles, pull up the ladder.  She found our clubhouse!

speaker: Niles
text: This cannot go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  Dad has to be politely told that even though he may enjoy her company he has no right to... what's the polite word for inflict?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I don't know, but I'm sure you'll find one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?  I have to do this alone?  I thought the two of us would sit him down and talk to him...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: ...both of us.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  I'm afraid you're the one who's going to be making that little speech.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Niles, both of us have a problem.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, ah, ah, ah.  She's not invading my apartment.  I can afford to be patient.

speaker: Frasier
text: You are a little weasel, aren't you?

speaker: Niles
text: A little weasel whose Daddy loves him. [_gets up_]

speaker: Sherry
text: [_coming to the table_] Niles, before I forget.  About your banquet - are we talking fancy-schmancy?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's not exactly the way it's worded on the invitation, but yes... [_the cold dawn of realisation hits_] Why? [_sits back down_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Daphne's got a cold so Sherry's going to use her ticket.

speaker: Frasier
text: What fun!  That's coming up soon, isn't it?  Maybe you should start working on that little speech.

speaker: Sherry
text: So, fancy dress, huh?  Good.  I got a backwards leopard skin number that's gonna knock your eyes out.

speaker: Martin
text: Gotcha! _Sherry and Martin both laugh hysterically.  Niles forces a laugh while looking annoyed.  Frasier is getting bumped into by Sherry as she laughs._

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I'm smushing you.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's all right.  We were just leaving.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, you gotta go?  Well Niles, don't worry about your banquet. I'll wear a nice dress and put on my best dancing shoes.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, there won't be dancing.

speaker: Sherry
text: You just leave that to Sherry! _Sherry and Martin both laugh again.  So does Niles, before rushing outside to join Frasier who has already escaped._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, your little banquet should prove quite amusing.  I hope Dr. Geudfreund doesn't aggravate his hernia when he goes underneath the limbo pole!

speaker: Niles
text: I have to talk to Dad.  I can't let her ruin the most important evening of my life.  What do I say to him? Frasier, you've got to help me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... prepared though you were to abandon me and let me handle all the dirty work alone, I will swallow my resentment, confront him with you tonight and take my share of the heat.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smiling_] Gotcha! _He walks off laughing.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 -- Frasier's Apartment. Martin is in his chair deciding over the night's entertainment. Niles is pacing the floor behind him. _

speaker: Martin
text: So Niles, what are you in the mood for?  Normandy or The Battle of the Bulge?

speaker: Niles
text: Whatever.

speaker: Martin
text: You've been fidgeting around all night.  Something on your mind?

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, yes actually.  It's about my awards banquet.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, this is very difficult to say.  I would really rather you didn't... [_chickens out_] wear those pants.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not.  I'm wearing that Avanti tux you gave me. What's your problem?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry.  I guess, I don't know, I'm just nervous about tomorrow night.  God knows why. _He sees Sherry's banjo lying on a chair and strums it before going outside onto the balcony._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming in_] Evening, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_notices Niles on the balcony and Martin in a foul mood_] Something wrong?

speaker: Martin
text: You know, that brother of yours can be downright insulting. He's so afraid that someone's going to embarrass him at his fancy dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er... you know, Niles told me about what he was going to say to you tonight.  And well, I must say that, in his defense, it is an important evening for him and well, let's face it, Sherry can be a bit much.

speaker: Martin
text: She can, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't mean it as a criticism, mind you.  Some people like that.  But now that Niles has broached the subject I must say that I too find Sherry a bit brassy and flamboyant... [_notices Martin's puzzled look_] He didn't say a word to you, did he?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't believe this.  You got a problem with Sherry?

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming back in_] That delightful woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, knock it off!  I see you're still waiting on that spine donor!  Dad, there is no reason to belabour this point...

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  You got something to say, let's hear it.  You don't like her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Please understand, Dad, as happy as we are that you've found someone...

speaker: Martin
text: But you don't like her?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  We're not saying that.  She's just not the sort of person that _we_ would normally choose to spend time with.

speaker: Martin
text: In other words, you don't like her?  Come on, we're all grown-ups here.  Tell me the truth.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pausing_] All right, Dad, we don't like her.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine!  That's the way you feel about it?  Don't worry, I won't bring her back here any more.  I guess it's too much to expect my own family to make a person I care about feel welcome!

speaker: Frasier
text: WAIT A MINUTE!  When did you ever make any of the women we were involved with feel welcome?

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh Frasier, you're right!  He almost got away with that!

speaker: Frasier
text: When did Lilith ever set foot in your house that you didn't make her feel as wanted as a fungus?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, not to mention my Maris!

speaker: Martin
text: You're comparing a warm lady like Sherry to Frosty the Snow- Wife?

speaker: Frasier
text: There!  That is exactly what I'm talking about.  Oh, why don't we just face facts?  I mean, since when has any of us ever - from Sherry to Lilith to Maris to Diane - has ever been able to pick one woman that the other two could stand the sight of?

speaker: Martin
text: I picked your mother!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_awkwardly_] I'm sorry, Niles. I've been hogging the floor.

speaker: Niles
text: Er...

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, forget it.  You're right.  Why should I expect you to make the effort when I'm no better?  Hell, you probably got it from me.  You sure didn't get it from your mother 'cos she was great that way.  Anytime she ever met anybody she could always find something to like about them.  One of the things I loved her for.  It's one of the things I love Sherry for.  She's a lot like your mother that way.  She'll always find something -- even with you two.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose we could all afford to be a bit more open- minded when it comes to each other's mates.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, at the very least, if we can't say anything nice we shouldn't say anything at all.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll be having some quiet Thanksgivings, but fine with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Sherry

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you look nice?  Come on in.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, thank you, Frasier.  Oh Marty, I brought you one more little gift. [_hands over a parcel_]

speaker: Martin
text: Another one?

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, I wanted to give it to you on your birthday but it took me a while to find the right size.

speaker: Martin
text: Really?  I'm usually a pretty easy fit.

speaker: Sherry
text: Who said it's for _you_ to wear?

speaker: Martin
text: Ho-ho, I like it already. _Niles and Frasier just roll their eyes slightly and look at each other.  Sherry notices their discomfort._

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, I should stop.  I'm embarrassing your boys.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you're not. [_looks at them both_] Is she?

speaker: Niles
text: [_clearly faking_] Nooooo!

speaker: Frasier
text: Party on!

speaker: Martin
text: [_holding Sherry's hand_] Well, I think we should go and unwrap this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad?  Lilith mentioned that she was going to be joining Frederick on his next visit.  You don't mind if she stays here, do you?

speaker: Martin
text: [_clearly faking_] Oh, Lilith!  No, great, I love Lilith. That's terrific.  She's welcome here any time.

speaker: Sherry
text: Honey, you're hurting my hand.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_to Niles and Frasier_] Oh listen, I should mention I'm kind of a sleepwalker, so if you get up in the night and find me in here naked, just give me a good hard shake.  I'll come to in a jiff.

speaker: Frasier
text: Got me, good one! _But Martin and Sherry aren't laughing.  The boys stop and look at each other worryingly... then Martin and Sherry burst out laughing.  As they head off to the bedroom Niles reaches for Martin's Ballantine.  End of Act 2_
